result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerrone Za'Marion Lawson

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Violation (New Criminal Charges) Report

Defendant Gerrone Za'Marion Lawson appeared by video.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III appeared by video for Gerrone Za'Marion Lawson.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine Fehrs appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel has offer and discovery and requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Gerrone Za'Marion Lawson appeared by video.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III appeared by video for Gerrone Za'Marion Lawson.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel has discovery and offer and requests additional time to review with defendant.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Gerrone Za'Marion Lawson in court with attorney Robert J Hampton appearing as a friend of the Court.  Defendant Gerrone Za'Marion Lawson in custody. Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court DENIES defense's motion to modify bail. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with J.E.L
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Gerrone Za'Marion Lawson in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Gerrone Za'Marion Lawson in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case retabbed to Branch 35 Lower number case pending.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
 This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
